intro: Duranta steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican trumpet bush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Verbenaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its clusters of tubular, blue to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Duranta steyermarkii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
